citation.article-title: Lactobacillus rennini sp. nov., isolated from rennin and associated with cheese spoilage.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Lactobacillus rennini sp. nov.
Lactobacillus rennini (ren.ni′ni. N.L. n. renninum rennin, an enzyme that coagulates milk and is used in making cheese; N.L. gen. n. rennini of rennin).
Cells are rod-shaped, 1 μm wide by 2–4 μm long, Gram-positive, catalase-negative, non-spore-forming and non-motile.
They are found singly and in pairs.
Grows better in MRS broth than on agar plates and under anaerobic conditions.
After 3 days of incubation in MRS agar at 30 °C, colonies are small (up to 1 mm in diameter), circular, translucent and grey.
Grows at 13 °C, but not at 4 or 45 °C.
No gas is produced from glucose or gluconate.
Both d- and l-lactic acid are produced.
Strains ferment l-arabinose, d-ribose, d-xylose, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose and N-acetylglucosamine.

Does not ferment glycerol, erythritol, d-arabinose, l-xylose, adonitol, methyl β-xyloside, l-sorbose, l-rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, sorbitol, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl α-d-glucoside, amygdalin, arbutin, salicin, d-cellobiose, melibiose, d-trehalose, inulin, melezitose, d-raffinose, starch, glycogen, xylitol, gentibiose, d-turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d-fucose, l-fucose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate or 5-ketogluconate.
The type strain also ferments d-mannitol, maltose, lactose and sucrose and hydrolyses aesculin.
The type strain, CECT 5922T (=DSM 20253T), was isolated from rennin by J.
Strain CECT 5923 (=DSM 20254), also isolated from rennin by J.
